                                            By 
Michael Hirsh


                                            By 
                                                    Josh Zeitz


                                            By 
Jack Shafer


                                            By 
                                                    John Conyers


                Cheryl Mills was deputy White House Counsel for President Bill Clinton. | AP Photo

                        Cheryl Mills' email shoots down speculation that Clinton would take on Obama in a 2012 primary.

            By 
Nick Gass

09/30/15 05:31 PM EDT
Hillary Clinton would never run for president again, her chief of staff Cheryl Mills insisted in 2011, and people in her orbit would "have to know" that, according to an email chain in the latest release of Clinton's State Department emails.
Mills forwarded to Clinton confidante Robert Barnett a POLITICO story on Sept. 8, 2011, that quoted former Vice President Dick Cheney remarking in an ABC interview that the secretary of state should run against President Barack Obama in 2012. 
Story Continued Below
"Maybe if— the Obama record is bad enough— and these days it's not very good, given the shape of the economy maybe there will be enough ferment in the Democratic Party so that there will be a primary on their side," Cheney was quoted as saying.
Barnett responded to Mills' email that he had heard the same thing "from several people each day."


"Today, one came from a high school friend who is probably the most politically conservative person I know. There is going to be an avalanche," he wrote, and offered to help tamp down the speculation: "We should have a strategy for responding. Keep it out of State. Happy to help if you wish."
Mills' response: "Folks have to know she would never do it - I thought cheney was poking potus"
The chief of staff long opposed her boss seeking another presidential bid, as The Associated Press reported that she would say Clinton was "crazy" for considering it.
"Honestly, nine out of ten people who are not on the 'in' think she will. It is only going to build," Barnett wrote in the email, which Mills forwarded to Clinton. "So, we should have some strategy based upon, of course, her wishes."
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: Cheryl Mills' email shoots down speculation that Clinton would take on Obama in a 2012 primary.
title: Hillary would 'never' run, top aide says in email
